headlamp noun [C]
(CAR LIGHT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
UK a large, powerful light at the front of a vehicle, usually one of two: You could see the beams of the car headlamps. I had to change a headlamp bulb on my car. Synonym
headlight
Mohamed Elkhamisy/EyeEm/GettyImages

headlamp noun [C]
(LIGHT FOR HEAD)
US (UK head torch) a light worn on the head, for example when going under the ground: Men wearing headlamps worked in tunnels as dark as tombs. The divers wore waterproof suits, helmets and headlamps.
JV Korotkova/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesWorkers' headlamps cut through the darkness.The surgeon wears a headlamp to control the light she needs.Wearing headlamps and 20-pound backpacks, they set out to jog an 85-mile loop around Glacier Peak.
